column5: True! With the high mercury levels coming down the Wabigoon river from Dryden, most people don't fish, or at least don't eat the fish from those waters.
Right on,and also if you fished it I think you would need a tackle shop right by the bridge

ive guided and fished there for years.We have always eaten fish from there.I know the guys that own cabins and they eat them all time.The mercury was from a long time ago and is covered up byknow.All the guests at North Star eat them.Doesnt seem to bother anyone.Fishing there is second to none for all species.
I fish here just before season closes.Fantastic bite from shore
John if you get the go pro figured out shoot a video of shore fishing there,do you use slip bobbers there?

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6540660]John if you get the go pro figured out shoot a video of shore fishing there,do you use slip bobbers there? in the river just jigs. the other place we go sometimes a bobber but depends on where ice is then.ill try to figure it out.
Those falls are awesome. I always stop if I have an FNG on the trip. (FNG = effen new guy). I tell him our flyout lake has similar falls that we'll be navigating.

But John, think of all the tax payer dollars that have been spend and will be spent to appease those (that we can't speak of) that say differently. I will admit to once having eaten a giant ling from down river, it tasted good cooked up as poor mans lobster, with the side benefit that since I now have ingested all of that mercury, I have the element needed to make my own thermometer.
Them ling are ugly and i hate touching them vut your right they are good eating.I also read that mercury is one of the ingredients they put in the vaccine so maybe you wont even need a shot.Äºol.
I love that spot. It is a beauty of a falls for sure. PjShorthorn
PJ did that vid go through
I couldn't open the vid. I just know the spot you are posting about. PjShorthorn
I bet below that falls is one snag infested rats nest,full of logs
Are you fishing the south side of the bridge at the bottom of the falls? Or are fishing the tailwaters on the north side of the bridge?
I really don't think anyone is fishing either side,but don't quote me on that

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6540348]I really don't think anyone is fishing either side,but don't quote me on that[/QUOTE I would agree. The only chance may be around the pool below the falls during high water. The falls are all rocks and log jams. PjShorthorn

there was a syntax error in your posted link, this one works https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L53au75cue0 Thanks for the memories ... driving past on 105 looking east. Water levels look a bit low and so does the snowpack.
